title: Cup And Saucer, ca. 1790–1800
dimensions:
Overall (a): 6.5 x 8.1 x 6.1 cm (2 9/16 x 3 3/16 x 2 3/8 in.)
Overall (b): 13 cm (5 1/8 in.)
description: Short cylindrical cup (a) with loop handle; gray-white ground decorated with polychrome-painted oval scene showing classical ruin of building wall with arches; thin gilt border around oval; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt lines; three incised concentric lines around base. Circular saucer (b) with gray-white ground decorated with central circular medalion surrounded by thin gilt border, showing classical ruin of wall with collumns in landscape; rim with underglaze blue band between two thin gilt bands.

exhibitions.title: Excavating Design: 18th-century Drawings and Prints from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup And Saucer, ca. 1790–1800.
ca. 1790–1800. Glazed porcelain. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1949-151-16-a,b.
